title: GCD Array Transformation Sum
problem_statement:
Sum of Array

Peter has an integer array A of size N. He must perform the operations listed below:

  1. Update all the elements of array A with the GCD (Greatest Common Divisor) of A[i] and the largest element in the subarray A[i] to A[i].
  2. After completing Operation 1, Peter must group the elements so that the largest element is grouped with smallest element and the second largest with second smallest and so on.
  3. Now he must find out the GCD of each group and insert their resultant value in a new array B.

Your task is to help Peter find and return an integer value, representing the sum of array B, after completing all the above operations.

Input Format

  • input1: An integer value N, representing the size of the array A.
  • input2: An integer array A.

Output Format

Return an integer value, representing the sum of array B.

Constraints

  • N is always even.
  • The value of i ranges from 0 to N-1.

Examples

Example 1:

input1: 4
input2: [1,14,11,19]
Output: 2

Here, the given array A is [1,14,11,19]. The operations are performed as follows:

  • Update array A with the GCD of A[i] and the largest element in the subarray A[i] to A[i]. A = {GCD(1,1), GCD(14,14), GCD(11,14), GCD(19,19)} = {1,14,1,19}.
  • Now group the elements in the following manner; the largest element is grouped with smallest element and the second largest is grouped with second smallest and so on, hence we create 2 groups as (1,19) and (1,14).
  • Now create a new array B = {GCD(Group 1), GCD(Group 2)} = {GCD(1,19), GCD(1,14)} = {1,1}.

Now we find the sum of all the elements in array B, which is 1+1 = 2. Hence, 2 is returned as the output.

Example 2:

input1: 8
input2: [14,1,2,16,10,11,9,8]
Output: 5

Here, the given array A is [14,1,2,16,10,11,9,8]. The operations are performed as follows:

  • Update array A with the GCD of A[i] and the largest element in the subarray A[i] to A[i]. A = {GCD(14,14), GCD(1,14), GCD(2,14), GCD(16,16), GCD(10,16), GCD(11,16), GCD(9,16), GCD(8,16)} = {14,1,2,16,2,1,1,8}.
  • Now group the elements in the following manner; the largest element is grouped with smallest element and the second largest is grouped with second smallest and so on, hence we create 4 groups as (1,16), (1,14), (1,8) and (2,2).
  • Now create a new array B = {GCD(Group 1), GCD(Group 2), GCD(Group 3), GCD(Group 4)} = {GCD(1,16), GCD(1,14), GCD(1,8), GCD(2,2)} = {1,1,1,2}.

Now we find the sum of all the elements in array B which is 1+1+1+2 = 5. Hence, 5 is returned as the output.
